page.title: 01Four Mid-Suffolk Parishes
page.content: Most of the land in the parishes of Beyton, Drink Stone, Hesset and Tostock is given over to agriculture (no longer a labour intensive industry) - primarily cereals (wheat, barley) and other crops (sugar beet, field beans, oil-seed rape and potatoes) but therre is also present a large herd of Charollais (Meade Farm, Drink Stone) that claimed many firsts at the 1985 Suffolk Agricultural Show. The parish churches are impressive, attractive, always well and lovingly tended both inside and out and sometimes (infrequently) even well attended. Apart from the churches, this area is dotted with large and imposing (often beautiful) rectories, manors, moated granges/farm housees and halls.
